tag_list: video-monetization, video-search, clickable-video, democracy, government, voting, bizdomu, university-of-michigan, detroit, michigan, young, nanotechnology, cleantech, anticipated-search, dem0cracy-org
overview:
Andrew Becker is an entrepreneur and consultant residing in San Francisco, CA.

He has a BSE in Industrial and Operations Engineering from the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. In 2009 he was a U. Michigan College of Engineering RMJ Abroad at Oxford University and studied arts and humanities.

In 2010 he completed the training program at BizdomU, a business incubator funded by Dan Gibert and based in TechTown, Detroit. His employers include PwC, The Cleantech Group and the Michigan Nanotechnology Institute for Medicine and Biological Studies (MNiMBS).

Andrew is currently advancing a non-profit concept, Dem0cracy.org, an engineered self-sustaining system for faster, cheaper, better democracy. He works as a Technical Consultant with Mark Gentry Partners, providing services to VC-backed start-up clients.
